repository.name: The Name of the Collection
repository.description: A description of the Collection that is being imported. What is written inside the xml tags is either an example of what should be there or a description of what should be there, this is not meant to confuse you, but to help you. I suggest reading an XML tutorial especially noticing what an IDREF is.

type.description: This is an Exapmle metadata.xml Collection.

recordstructure.name: Example RecordStructure
recordstructure.description: This is an explanatory Example RecordStructure description.

partstructure.name: title
partstructure.description: This is the description of what the title partstructure is, it is a string that is the title of the data in the asset (e.g. song name, painting name, etc.).

type.description: This value for a part of this partstructure should always be a string. Also, not all 'type' elements need to be described.

partstructure.name: keywords
partstructure.description: This is the description of what the keywords partstructure is...

partstructure.name: description
partstructure.description: This is the description of what the description partstructure is...

partstructure.name: Order
partstructure.description: This is the description of what the order partstructure is...

asset.name: The name of the first Asset
asset.description: The description of the first Asset. Note that the metadata stored in a 'record' is associated with its 'recordstructure' via the xml:id used in this xml file, the same for 'parts' and 'partstructures', as shown below.

type.description: The keyword should explain what type of Asset this is.
